Award.AbstractNarration: This is a post-doctoral travel grant to allow a professional meeting and consultation between Adam Fudickar (PI) and Dr. Marilyn Ramenofsky at the University of California, Davis. During the meeting, Dr. Fudickar and Dr. Ramenofsky will discuss the structure of a potential proposal to address the potential response of arctic breeding migratory birds to climate change. The visit will also provide the opportunity for Mr. Fudickar to visit the research facilities at UC Davis and discuss the project proposal with other researchers in the Department of Neurobiology, Physiology, and Behavior.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The awarded project provided funds for my travel to Davis California for a meeting between Dr. Marilyn Ramenofsky at the University of California, Davis. The intended outcome of the meeting was an agreement on the worthiness of a Polar Regions Postdoc proposal. If said proposal was agreed to, submitted, and rewarded, then it would establish an advisee relationship between Dr. Ramenofsky and myself.

During the meeting Dr. Ramenofsky and I discussed our mutual research interests and the structure and merit of a proposal addressing the potential response of arctic breeding migratory birds to climate change. While at Davis, I presented a seminar to the animal behavior group and met with collaborators of Dr. Ramenofsky. The visit also provided me with the opportunity to visit the research facilities at UC Davis and discuss the project proposal with other researchers in the Department of Neurobiology, Physiology, and Behavior. 

Although the meeting was successful, I did not submit a full project proposal to NSF because I accepted another post doc position. Despite this outcome, the award helped establish a working relationship between Dr. Ramenofsky and myself that is sure to be fruitful in the future. Additionally, my visit to UC Davis established new scientific relationships that I expect to develop.   

 


Last Modified: 01/07/2013
Modified by: Adam M Fudickar
